intro: Disynaphia ericoides, commonly known as the dwarf heath, is a small evergreen shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant typically has dark green, leathery leaves that are arranged in whorls around the stems. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, blooming in the spring. Disynaphia ericoides thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in pine flatwood and scrub habitats.
